reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not supposed to be staying at this hotel, however on arrival we were told our hotel had been changed to this one, but that’s a whole different story!
reviews.title: All in all lovely hotel would definately return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival at Oasis Papagayo I was pleasantly surprised, the reception is big and spacious with automatic opening glass doors and a nice tiled parrot on the floor as you walk in. The check in was very easy with friendly staff who spoke multiple languages very well. We hired a safe straight away which was 15 Euros plus a 10 Euro deposit which you get back at check out.
reviews.title: a typical 3 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was quite a walk from the reception, a nice walk though, through the gardens and trees or a shorter walk by the swimming pool. I’m sure if we had asked for a closer room it would have been fine, but we are quite young and with all the extra eating thought the exercise would be good!
reviews.title: A wonderful winter break!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room itself was clean and spacious, we had 2 rings, a TV (which you have to pay 4 Euros per day to use to get any channels other than BBC World News) Kettle, toaster, microwave and fridge with small freezer section. There are a selection of pans in the cupboards, plates, cups and cutlery. The handle of our frying pan fell off when I picked it up, but everything else was clean and we found we had everything we needed. The bathroom had a large mirror and sink area, I always find it a little awkward to put my make up on when I can’t lean closer to the mirror, due to the sink area sticking out, but there is another large mirror in the bedroom. The shower was okay, its not very powerful and the hot water runs out pretty quickly, but doesn’t seem to take too long before you have hot water again. The bathroom was clean, although there were some badly rusted bits under the sink area, which I only noticed when I sat in the bath and didn’t bother me in the slightest, but I expect it’s something that would bother some people.
reviews.title: Nice place, long walk into town, below average food...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were self catering and did not eat in the restaurant; and the pizza place near the pool within the complex was shut the whole time we were there. The bar was spacious and the staff friendly, there are 2 pool tables and a large projector showing BBC News before entertainment began. Drinks were around the same price as in a UK bar, however with spirits you get around 3 times as much per shot! Entertainment was quite good; there was bingo every night which was a laugh. I believe there was karaoke, a birds of prey show – didn’t last very long but was good and could have photos taken, ABBA tribute night, music quiz, and I think there may have been a magic show one night too. We only saw the karaoke and birds of prey show and participated in bingo a few times and enjoyed it all.
reviews.title: good holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our holiday here even though the food and service in the so called restaurant(canteen) were very poor. It served very poor food and kept running out of cups, glasses and cutlery etc. It seemed that if they ran out of something they wern't keen to replace it. The food at the pool was always luke warm burgers and chips.
reviews.title: Cheap all inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: On the upside the pool area was clean and tidy with plenty of sunbeds.
reviews.title: Perfect November Sun Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also the rooms were large and well equiped but they were not cleaned very often, but they did change the towels often and kept the bathroom well supplied.
reviews.title: If you want a cheap all inclusive holiday thats exactly what you will get !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There was entertainment as well which was ok.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We didn't pay much to stay here so on that basis it wasn't a bad place to stay.
reviews.title: Food is the worst I've ever eaten in any hotel I've ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We travelled on Christmas Day with two young children aged 4 and 6. We stayed for one week.
reviews.title: Go elsewhere. Not good enough.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through Thomson who, although were still at the hotel, had pulled out of the entertainment side of things in October 2010. Matthew the rep was excellent, and although we never spoke, he seemed to be always available.
reviews.title: I hope this will set the record straight about this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel: Apartments very spacious but a little tired and the floor hadn't been mopped for months - feet ended up black after a walk from the bathroom to the bedroom. The gardens and surrounding landscaped area are very pleasant, however, on closer inspection you could see that nobody cared about the ciggie butts EVERYWHERE!
reviews.title: room tired needs refurb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff were pleasant and helpful - especially on reception. We hired a safe but didn't bother with the TV. Beds fairly comfy. Towels were changed regularly and beds were clean. Slept well - even without copious amounts of alcohol! Never had a problem with hot water. Kitchenette (with fridge, kettle, toaster and two ring electric hob) was adequate for making toast, sandwiches and a cuppa.
reviews.title: Taken me a long time to write this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant: Never had a problem finding a table. Breakfast was ok, full English - bacon a bit plastic and tasteless and a couple of days there weren’t any ‘proper’ sausages – the little tinned ones were awful. However, the eggs (alternated daily between scrambled and fried, hard boiled always available), tinned toms, beans and fried bread, etc all fine, fruit was fresh. The so called continental - one type salami, one cheese – pretty rubbish compared to similar hotels - cereals low quality imitations. Tea and coffee ok but fruit juices low quality - I don't expect freshly squeezed but at least a better quality concentrate would have been nice - I've had better in other 3* accommodation. Evening meal a bit mixed. Salads always fresh, bread not so. Hot meals a bit lacking and as others have said, tepid at best. The Christmas Gala meal (As Thomson promised in their brochure) was laughable. Turkey roll sliced by the chef behind the counter in an attempt to put a bit of positive spin on the evening. It was awful really as you’d have thought you'd get all the trimmings that comes with a Christmas Dinner. Nope, just chips. No gravy. Yes, it was cold. The rest of the week was the same story. Lacking of choice, tepid food. I have been to many similar places in the Canaries and the Med over the past 20 years or so. This is the worst I’ve experienced. There's a serious problem with plates, glasses and cutlery running out. Not enough staff to keep things in check. The fact that we had to walk through the smoking area (indoors) each morning and evening to get to the restaurant was just bad management by the hotel. I’m a social smoker but this wasn’t what I wanted to endure every day, thanks, especially with my kids. At lunchtime the restaurant opens but we didn't use it. We used the buffet at the poolside bar. Basic burgers, hotdogs, pizza - a couple of days there were jacket potatoes. Not too bad but the burgers and sausages were again extremely low quality. Salad was always fresh. Ice cream (small pots of Nestle) was always kept frozen - so none of that crystalised defrosted/refrozen ice cream that you sometimes see. We ate out three times, twice in Correlejo and once just down the road at Tiffanys - a decent place for English food - their home made puddings are excellent.
reviews.title: Pity food not to standard of facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: I stayed at the Oasis Papagayo at the start of February and had a fantastic time! For the money we paid for it we couldn't complain at all! I travelled as part of a large group (22 of us!) and as the organiser for the group I was a little worried having booked the Oasis Papagayo after reading all of the reviews on here! But there was nothing to worry about!
reviews.title: Good Value for Money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in staff on reception were very helpful as we checked in our large group and were very friendly.
reviews.title: Tired and in need of a revamp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was a little dated and could of done with a lick of paint but I dont go on holiday to sit in the hotel room! It was clean and spacious and did the job!
reviews.title: Well worth a visit, give it a go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a 15 minute walk into town which wasn't bad as there were no big hills or anything - just a nice stroll. But a taxi was only a few euros if you dont want to do the walk.
reviews.title: Absolutley Fabulous... we've booked to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself was fairly quiet but Im sure even when it is busy there are still lots of sun loungers available! I have never seen so many sun loungers in one hotel! There are also 2 other pools and a jacuzzi towards the back of the hotel but we didn't venture down there too much as it was so quiet and a trek back to the poolside bar. The only thing I would say is that it would have been nice to have had a heated pool to go in! All 4 pools and the jacuzzi were FREEZING cold! So there weren't many people going in the water!
reviews.title: Typical 3 star all inclusive - very average!
